channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-16222] add a setting to disable row.serde for specific formats; enable for others
item.description:
Per gopalv

row.serde = true ... breaks Parquet (they expect to get the same object back, which means you can't buffer 1024 rows).

We want to enable this and vector.serde for text vectorization. Need to turn it off for specific formats.
item.summary: add a setting to disable row.serde for specific formats; enable for others

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: cc mmccline
A simple patch. cc gopalv mmccline

ROW_DESERIALIZE_BLACKLIST could be a config.

That part will need to be undone in the patch fixing Parquet - +1 pending a clean run.
ROW_DESERIALIZE_INPUT_FORMAT_EXCLUDE_LIST might be a better name.
Renamed the list and moved it to config

ATTACHMENT ID: 12860208 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

sershe I'd like to see some Q file cases showing an attempt to use the org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat input file format and it not being allowed.

And detail in the not met conditions showing why row-mode was not used...

         enabled: false
         enabledConditionsNotMet: hive.vectorized.use.row.serde.deserialize IS true AND hive.vectorized.row.serde.inputformat.excludes [org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat] NOT CONTAINS org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat IS false
         groupByVectorOutput: true
         inputFileFormats: org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat

Or:

         enabled: false
         enabledConditionsNotMet: hive.vectorized.use.row.serde.deserialize IS true AND org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat NOT IN hive.vectorized.row.serde.inputformat.excludes [org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat] IS false
         groupByVectorOutput: true
         inputFileFormats: org.apache.parquet.hadoop.ParquetInputFormat
Actually is this patch even relevant? Upon adding the test I see that Parquet is now natively vectorized. Was there a specific problem/failure when enabling row.serde for all formats?

Updated the patch... I guess for a contrived case where input format is disabled that is possible.
Is there a reason to disable vectorized input format if vectorization is enabled?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12874943 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
mmccline ping?
+1 LGTM
Committed to master. Thanks for the review!
sershe, I don't see this commit in email or github.
sershe, leftylev is right, this hasn't been committed yet.
Looks like I forgot to push this

Doc note: This adds hive.vectorized.row.serde.inputformat.excludes to HiveConf.java and changes the default value of hive.vectorized.use.row.serde.deserialize to true, so the wiki needs to be updated.

  • Configuration Properties – Vectorization
    • hive.vectorized.use.row.serde.deserialize

Added a TODOC3.0 label.

(Welcome back, Sergey.)
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
